description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Graham Nichols house, Greenwich, Connecticut. Spirea borders] [ca. 1917 or 1918] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Other: The photographer identified this image in her prints as Miss RR Goodnow--Graham Nichols place. Associated Name: Ruby Ross Goodnow (Wood) decorated the house. On slide (handwritten): "Nichols." Also, blind embossed stamp "Frances B. Johnston, New York." Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16640 Call Number: LC-J717-X106- 70
